Yohanes Santoso wrote:
> What John said and also how do you handle the fact that one client's
> last is not necessarily another's. At the very least clients need to
> identify themselves to the server. I used a personalised URI in
> another email to meet that requirement.

If you use "personalised" (i.e. different) URLs, then these represent
different queue resources.

If you really mean to have a personalised queue, use the same URL to
reference the queue, and authentication to identify the client.
-- 
Chris Burdess
